text: The <extra_id_0> SerpinB2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> Proximal Promoter Confers LPS Responsiveness

To investigate cis - acting regulatory elements responsive to LPS in the 5 ' flanking region of the murine <extra_id_0> SerpinB2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> gene , nucleotides -4480 to +92 and a series of generated deletion mutants of the 5 ' flanking region were cloned upstream of a promoter - less firefly <extra_id_0> luciferase <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> reporter gene ( pGL3 Basic ) ( Fig . 2A ) .

The reporter constructs were then transiently transfected into sub-confluent RAW264.7 macrophages and assayed for <extra_id_0> luciferase <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> activity in the presence and absence of LPS or PMA , for comparison .

PMA - induced <extra_id_0> SerpinB2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> gene regulation has been extensively studied in human macrophage cell lines [ 45 ] - [ 47 ] , and has been shown to occur through several proximal and distal AP-1 responsive elements [ 30 ] ; [ 37 ] ; [ 47 ] - [ 51 ] .

As shown in Fig . 2B , the <extra_id_0> SerpinB2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> 5 ' flanking region from -4480 to +92 directs both PMA - and LPS - inducible transcription , approximately 2-fold and 7-fold , respectively .

Deletion of the murine <extra_id_0> SerpinB2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> promoter from -1686 to -1341 increased LPS-inducibility to approximately 16-fold , indicating the presence of a silencer element in this region .

Further deletion beyond -539 abolished the LPS - response of the promoter , indicating the presence of an essential LPS response element in the region between -539 and -189 ; however , the response of the murine <extra_id_0> SerpinB2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> promoter to PMA is less affected by this deletion .

While deletion of the <extra_id_0> SerpinB2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> promoter from -189 to -87 eliminated the LPS response and marginally reduced the PMA response , the -87 murine <extra_id_0> SerpinB2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> promoter construct was still partially responsive to PMA , indicating that cis - acting elements mediating the response of the murine <extra_id_0> SerpinB2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> promoter to PMA also lie downstream of nucleotide -87 .
